alert.note: Alert for Screven (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 8:58PM EDT until June 21 at 7:05AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Georgia, including the following county, Screven. Portions of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Allendale and Hampton. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 857 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sylvania, Hiltonia, Newington, Altman, Burtons Ferry Landing, Hilltonia, Hunters, Millhaven, Captolo, Woodcliff, Green Hill, Farmdale, White Hill, Bascom, Waters, Lewis, Sheppards, Milbury, Plantation Airpark and Goloid.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
